thag11.1:1.1: “What good does it do you to be in the grove, my dear?
thag11.1:1.2: You’re like a little bird in the rain!
thag11.1:1.3: The city of Verambhā is nice for you—
thag11.1:2.2: scatters the clouds as they pour down,
thag11.1:3.1: “It’s all black and born of an egg—
thag11.1:3.2: the crow that lives in the charnel ground
thag11.1:3.4: based on dispassion for the body.
thag11.1:4.3: such a monk sleeps at ease,
thag11.1:5.1: The water’s clear and the rocks are broad,
thag11.1:5.2: monkeys and deer are all around;
thag11.1:7.2: May they be slaughtered! May they suffer!’—
thag11.1:7.3: I’m not aware of having any such
thag11.1:8.3: The heavy burden is laid down,
thag11.1:8.4: the attachment to rebirth is eradicated.
thag11.1:9.2: for the sake of which I went forth
thag11.1:9.3: from the lay life to homelessness—
thag11.1:10.4: like a worker waiting for their wages.
